content: page �4 of 5 face embroider a nose patch or triangle at the v-point of the short-row muzzle with the longest part of the nose parallel to the top of the head stitch from the mid-point of the bottom of the nose in an elongated stitch to the midpoint of the mouth stitch from that point in each direction for the two sides of the mouth embroider eyes consider adding a twinkle of white in the eye to avoid the dead-eye look variations and additions add safety eyes and a safety nose knit a short flat tail or add a yarn french knot tail appropriately placed vary the yarn weight and needle size for a smaller or larger bear the models are wearing mistake rib scarves to reproduce those cast on 6 stitches and knit 2 purl 1 across each row for about 14 inches/36 cm if you knit a hat add two buttonholes placed so the bear s ears can be pulled through sunrise side bear is not at all fussy about clothes knitting a vest can be as easy as knitting two squares and sewing them together leaving arm and neck openings knit a pillow and blanket page �5 of 5
